abstract: A strike at a Ford Motor Company assembly line in St. Petersburg highlights the tightening labor market in Russia, a problem that would have seemed inconceivable a few years ago.
snippet: A strike at a Ford Motor Company assembly line in St. Petersburg highlights the tightening labor market in Russia, a problem that would have seemed inconceivable a few years ago.
lead_paragraph: VSEVOLOZHSK, Russia, Dec. 7  A strike at the Ford Motor Company assembly line has slowed production and cost the company, the pioneer of foreign car manufacturing in Russia, millions of dollars in lost production. Workers walked off the job on Nov. 22 at the Ford plant in this outlying district of St. Petersburg.

headline.main: In Russia, Ford Hurt by Strike and Rising Pay
